channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: @johncarlosbaez @j_bertolotti @lmrocha @lamaral @thilo @c4computation @tchambersWithin the same framework, do you know about any model that, once fine grained at some resolution, shows:- locally (fine grain) : rather a constant variance over time (but it can have an increasing mean, eg )- globally (coarse grain) : an increasing variance (and increasing mean too)Essentially, local fluctuations look stable, but the way they combine at larger spatial scales lead to unstable fluctuations with diverging moments.

item.title: Mick Craig
item.description: PhD alert! We have a FULLY FUNDED #neuroscience project looking at thalamic place cells in rat. Lots of fun in vivo ephys & spatial navigation, in a project led by the awesome Kate Jeffery. Deadline 30th Sep, project to start by January. Please retoot and reach out to us if you have questions! #FindAPhD

item.title: Andrew Plested
item.description: Pretty even-handed assessment of the success and failure of the EU-funded Human Brain Project, which is ending. Probably the most impressive thing is that, given its troubled inception, it produced some meaningful, if rather ad hoc, brain science. #HBP #brain #simulation #neuroscience https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-02600-x

item.title: Cian O’Donnell
item.description:
My dept at Ulster University are hiring for 2x Computer Science Lecturer (Asst Prof) posts. Come join us!I love the dept and city of Derry. Affordable living (eg can buy a decent house for <£200K). People here are incredibly friendly.Panel ideally wants researchers in any of:
AI
Computer Networks
IoT/Pervasive Computing
Games Development
Neurotechnologyhttps://my.corehr.com/pls/coreportal_ulsp/erq_jobspec_version_4.display_form?p_company=1&p_internal_external=E&p_display_in_irish=N&p_applicant_no=&p_recruitment_id=022187&p_process_type=&p_form_profile_detail=&p_display_apply_ind=Y&p_refresh_search=Y

item.title: Grace Lindsay
item.description:
🚨 New Paper (that I forgot to share on Mastodon)! "Testing methods of neural systems understanding" by me & David Bau is online now. We argue for an explicit test of the tools used to understand 'neural systems', i.e. brains and artificial neural networks. https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1389041723000906
#neuroscience #AI #MachineLearning

item.title: Grace Lindsay
item.description: This paper is built heavily from my previous pre-print ("Testing the Tools of Systems Neuroscience on Artificial Neural Networks": http://arxiv.org/abs/2202.07035) but working with David allowed for a more thorough integration with the field of interpretable AI!

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
Troubling story in Times Higher Education by Philip Moriarty, Prof of Physics at University of Nottingham.
https://www.timeshighereducation.com/blog/im-being-docked-pay-boycotting-marking-i-teach-free#comment-68607. It's behind a paywall, so I'll summarise. His salary is 100% from EPSRC research fellowship, but he does some teaching (which he's v good at) bcs he likes it, is good at it, and is public-spirited. Now Uni is docking his pay bcs he participated in a marking boycott as part of industrial action.
#university #strike #administration 1/2

item.title: 𝐿𝒶𝓃𝒶 :verifiedtrans:
item.description: @RickiTarr @AirlockDoc Oooh! Storytime!When I was a little Lana The Musician, one of my heroes was Yo-yo Ma. Growing up in a tiny little backwater town in Kansas, though, my only real contact with him were his albums. I would listen to them on rotation literally all day long in my pocket DiscMan. (That'll tell you how old I am!) Well, one day I found out he was actually coming into town to play as the featured soloist with the Wichita Symphony Orchestra. I was over the moon with excitement! I had been volunteering at WSO for the last couple of years, because they allowed you to sit in and listen to the symphony when you were done taking tickets and opening/closing doors. So I was determined to go usher for his performance. The day came, and the house was packed. I could barely contain myself. Yo-yo was actually here! In the same building! Then disaster struck! Try as I might, I could not find an empty seat anywhere in the theatre! 🧵/1 for the rest of the story
